body: aha you are right, your title is miss leading.

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

body:
Thanks for the quick fix!

I didn't mean to be misleading; tried my best ;)

Any idea when it would make it to an npm release?
I see it's been release. Awesome!
oops, too many notifications, I missed your last message... yes it's released.
can you help me to reproduce that in a codesandbox? i will take a look at tonight.
oh... I think i know why, reValidateMode doesn't support `all`...

Ah, nice catch. I changed to this but still didn't work:
```js
mode: 'onBlur',
reValidateMode: 'onBlur',
```

The CSB I included in my initial message here was forked from https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/discussions/2179

OK, I polished up this ticket's CSB and was able to reproduce... _finally_ :)

Same link as before: https://codesandbox.io/s/rhf-react-select-setvalue-isvalid-g9dk2?file=/src/index.js

Notice that the value of the first React Select _does_ get filled (satisfying its Required rule) and then picking something manually for second React Select works for 2nd field but entire form's `formState.isValid` is not true until you manually touch (blur) the 1st field.

Thanks for the help. Bedtime for me...

@cliffordp i think you miss the `shouldValidat: true`

`setValue("MyReactSelect", { value: "1", label: "User ID#1" }, { shouldValidate: true }); ðŸ‘ `

omg, tyvm! it worked.

I reread https://react-hook-form.com/api#setValue and see it says "you _can_ set..." but I guess I thought _shouldn't it validate by default?_

Is there a reason not to? I get making it a param that can be controlled but why wouldn't the default behavior be that if I'm setting a value it should trigger validation checking.

Typing it out, I think I'm misunderstanding the parameter... "shouldValidate" means "force validating as true", not "should trigger validation checking", correct? Why? Why shouldn't setValue() trigger all the validation checking so I don't have to force-set as valid or not?

For example, if I set the value to something that satisfied "required: true", it should validate _even though it didn't blur._ But if I for some reason set it to `""` then validation would be false because the _required_ check fails.

So, to me, `setValue()` should trigger the "is valid?" checking _regardless of the useForm() params, but allow setValue's params to override this default behavior, such as `shouldCheck: false` (with a better name for the param).

Please share your feedback.

Thanks for your feedback!

1. `setValue` does not validate the input by default is not **new**, it starts from the very first version. 
2. `setValue` should not validate input by default, it's extra functionality that users want to validate the input or set the field to dirty, they are an extension of the base's functionality. 
3. consistency, all of our API's default config start to be `false`. (setValue's config)

**Conclusion:**

we will stay as it is, unfortunately, you will have to adapt to the current API until the next breaking change. please feels free to bring up this topic again next time. In fact, before V6's release, we asked the community to give feedback with the RC version (include with all the release notes), that was the perfect time to have those feedback.
